@madisonc_morris @CSBSJU @csbsju_sfct Thanks! And thank you for bringing this event to my attention. I've been disappointed in CSB/SJU for a while, and this event obviously doesn't help that. It's too bad how far left they've moved since I graduated.
@AndrewJThom @CSBSJU @csbsju_sfct This is a great thread. Thanks for sharing!

College is supposed to prepare students for the real world by opening our minds and allowing us to form our own opinions. @CSBSJU is instead indoctrinating its students with liberal ideas while suppressing conservative viewpoints.

If @CSBSJU wanted to create an inclusive environment for all, they would bring in someone alongside Mr. Kendi to have a discussion regarding critical race theory. But sponsoring this event with him alone does not allow the students to develop their own opinion.

The fact that a sophomore at a liberal arts school believes that freedom of speech should be eliminated is proof that @CSBSJU is not properly preparing its students for the real world. People don't lose their rights just because your feelings get hurt.

‚ÄúEvery policy in every institution in every community in every nation is producing or sustaining either racial inequity or equity.‚Äù 

‚ÄúCapitalism is essentially racist... and racism is essentially capitalist.‚Äù 

This is what @CSBSJU is pushing students to attend.
